result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:40 AM Defendant Devon A Sheriff in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Devon A Sheriff.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Jason Krueger, of the City of Brookfield Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Sitzberger.
Cross examination by attorney Sonderhouse.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
Attorney Sonderhouse states he has advised his client from not testify at this time.  The Defendant wants to testify against his attorney's advise. 
Devon Sheriff (Defendant) sworn in and testifies on direct on by attorney Sonderhouse.
Cross examination by ADA Sitzberger.
The witness is excused and the Defense rests.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Letter filed by the Defendant**Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 10/19 "No action by this court. The Defendant has qualified for representation through the Public Defender's Office, and any requested action needs to be made through motion by his attorneys."
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:22 PM Defendant Devon A Sheriff in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Devon A Sheriff. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Attorney Herbers requests an additional status of counsel date.  The Court is inclined to set a preliminary hearing.  The defendant requests a preliminary hearing within 10 days.  Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS. Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

2:16 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Devon A Sheriff in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Devon A Sheriff. Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant did not want to be evaluated by the SPD and stated he was going to seek counsel. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Devon A Sheriff
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd., Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 10-11-2022)
Prior: 3353 N Buffum St, Milwaukee, WI 53212
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on October 11th, 2022.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
